subject: Chemistry
question: In an exothermic reaction, the sign of \(\Delta H\) is:
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: Heat is released; \(\Delta H<0\).

subject: Chemistry
question: In endothermic processes, heat flows into the system from surroundings.
wrong_response: Review: Surroundings cool; system absorbs heat.

subject: Chemistry
question: Using \(Q=mc\Delta T\), compute \(Q\) for \(m=50\,\text{g}, c=4.18\,\text{J g}^{-1}{}^{\circ}\text{C}^{-1}, \Delta T=10^{\circ}\text{C}\) in kJ.
wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. Multiply then divide by \(1000\).

subject: Chemistry
question: Which bond is typically formed by electron transfer?
hint: Hint: Transfer forms ions that attract.
good_response: Correct! Transfer forms ions that attract.
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: Transfer forms ions that attract.

subject: Chemistry
question: Polar covalent bonds arise from unequal sharing of electrons.
wrong_response: Review: Electronegativity difference causes polarity.

subject: Chemistry
question: Molar mass of \(H_2O\) (g/mol) to two decimals.
wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. 2(H:1.008)+O:16.00.

subject: Chemistry
question: Le Châtelier’s principle: increasing pressure shifts equilibrium toward the side with:
options: ["more gas moles", "fewer gas moles", "no change", "solid phase"]
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: System counteracts the stress.

subject: Chemistry
question: A solution with \(\text{pH}=3\) is acidic.
wrong_response: Review: pH<7 indicates acidity.

subject: Chemistry
question: If \([H^+]=1.0\times10^{-4}\,\text{M}\), compute the pH.
wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. Use \(\text{pH}=-\log[H^+]\).

subject: Chemistry
question: Boyle’s Law states for a fixed \(n,T\):
hint: Hint: Pressure inversely varies with volume.
good_response: Correct! Pressure inversely varies with volume.
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: Pressure inversely varies with volume.

subject: Chemistry
question: According to Charles’ Law, volume is directly proportional to absolute temperature at constant pressure.
wrong_response: Review: V∝T at constant P.

subject: Chemistry
question: Using \(PV=nRT\): \(P=1.0\,\text{atm}, V=24.5\,\text{L}, T=298\,\text{K}\). Compute \(n\) (use \(R=0.08206\,\text{L atm mol}^{-1}\text{K}^{-1}\)).
wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. Rearrange: \(n=\frac{PV}{RT}\).

wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. Rearrange: \(n=\frac{PV}{RT}\).

subject: Chemistry
question: In an exothermic reaction, the sign of \(\Delta H\) is:
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: Heat is released; \(\Delta H<0\).

subject: Chemistry
question: In endothermic processes, heat flows into the system from surroundings.
wrong_response: Review: Surroundings cool; system absorbs heat.

subject: Chemistry
question: Using \(Q=mc\Delta T\), compute \(Q\) for \(m=50\,\text{g}, c=4.18\,\text{J g}^{-1}{}^{\circ}\text{C}^{-1}, \Delta T=10^{\circ}\text{C}\) in kJ.
wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. Multiply then divide by \(1000\).

hint: Hint: Transfer forms ions that attract.
good_response: Correct! Transfer forms ions that attract.

question: Polar covalent bonds arise from unequal sharing of electrons.

wrong_response: Review: V∝T at constant P.

subject: Chemistry
question: Using \(PV=nRT\): \(P=1.0\,\text{atm}, V=24.5\,\text{L}, T=298\,\text{K}\). Compute \(n\) (use \(R=0.08206\,\text{L atm mol}^{-1}\text{K}^{-1}\)).
wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. Rearrange: \(n=\frac{PV}{RT}\).

subject: Chemistry
question: In an exothermic reaction, the sign of \(\Delta H\) is:
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: Heat is released; \(\Delta H<0\).

subject: Chemistry
question: In endothermic processes, heat flows into the system from surroundings.
wrong_response: Review: Surroundings cool; system absorbs heat.

subject: Chemistry
question: Using \(Q=mc\Delta T\), compute \(Q\) for \(m=50\,\text{g}, c=4.18\,\text{J g}^{-1}{}^{\circ}\text{C}^{-1}, \Delta T=10^{\circ}\text{C}\) in kJ.
wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. Multiply then divide by \(1000\).

subject: Chemistry
question: Which bond is typically formed by electron transfer?
hint: Hint: Transfer forms ions that attract.
good_response: Correct! Transfer forms ions that attract.
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: Transfer forms ions that attract.

subject: Chemistry
question: Polar covalent bonds arise from unequal sharing of electrons.
wrong_response: Review: Electronegativity difference causes polarity.

subject: Chemistry
question: Molar mass of \(H_2O\) (g/mol) to two decimals.
wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. 2(H:1.008)+O:16.00.

subject: Chemistry
question: Le Châtelier’s principle: increasing pressure shifts equilibrium toward the side with:
options: ["more gas moles", "fewer gas moles", "no change", "solid phase"]
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: System counteracts the stress.

subject: Chemistry
question: A solution with \(\text{pH}=3\) is acidic.
wrong_response: Review: pH<7 indicates acidity.

subject: Chemistry
question: If \([H^+]=1.0\times10^{-4}\,\text{M}\), compute the pH.
wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. Use \(\text{pH}=-\log[H^+]\).

subject: Chemistry
question: Boyle’s Law states for a fixed \(n,T\):
hint: Hint: Pressure inversely varies with volume.
good_response: Correct! Pressure inversely varies with volume.
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: Pressure inversely varies with volume.

wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. Use \(\text{pH}=-\log[H^+]\).

subject: Chemistry
question: Boyle’s Law states for a fixed \(n,T\):
hint: Hint: Pressure inversely varies with volume.
good_response: Correct! Pressure inversely varies with volume.
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: Pressure inversely varies with volume.

subject: Chemistry
question: According to Charles’ Law, volume is directly proportional to absolute temperature at constant pressure.
wrong_response: Review: V∝T at constant P.

subject: Chemistry
question: Using \(PV=nRT\): \(P=1.0\,\text{atm}, V=24.5\,\text{L}, T=298\,\text{K}\). Compute \(n\) (use \(R=0.08206\,\text{L atm mol}^{-1}\text{K}^{-1}\)).
wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. Rearrange: \(n=\frac{PV}{RT}\).

subject: Chemistry
question: In an exothermic reaction, the sign of \(\Delta H\) is:
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: Heat is released; \(\Delta H<0\).

subject: Chemistry
question: In endothermic processes, heat flows into the system from surroundings.
wrong_response: Review: Surroundings cool; system absorbs heat.

subject: Chemistry
question: Using \(Q=mc\Delta T\), compute \(Q\) for \(m=50\,\text{g}, c=4.18\,\text{J g}^{-1}{}^{\circ}\text{C}^{-1}, \Delta T=10^{\circ}\text{C}\) in kJ.
wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. Multiply then divide by \(1000\).

subject: Chemistry
question: Which bond is typically formed by electron transfer?
hint: Hint: Transfer forms ions that attract.
good_response: Correct! Transfer forms ions that attract.
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: Transfer forms ions that attract.

subject: Chemistry
question: Polar covalent bonds arise from unequal sharing of electrons.
wrong_response: Review: Electronegativity difference causes polarity.

wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. 2(H:1.008)+O:16.00.

question: With \(V\) constant, doubling \(R\) makes current \(I\):
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: \(I=V/R\).

unit: Unit: Intro to Physics & Scientific Method
question: In series circuits, current is the same through all components.
wrong_response: Review: Series path carries one current.

subject: Physics
unit: Unit: Intro to Physics & Scientific Method

wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. Use \(I=V/R\).

subject: Physics
unit: Unit: Intro to Physics & Scientific Method
question: The period of a simple pendulum of length \(L\) (small angles) is approximated by:
hint: Hint: Depends on length and \(g\), not mass.
good_response: Correct! Depends on length and \(g\), not mass.
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: Depends on length and \(g\), not mass.

subject: Physics
unit: Unit: Intro to Physics & Scientific Method
question: For uniform circular motion, acceleration points toward the center.
wrong_response: Review: Centripetal acceleration is inward.

subject: Physics
unit: Unit: Intro to Physics & Scientific Method
question: A projectile launched at \(u=20\,\text{m/s}\) at \(30^{\circ}\), ignore air: initial vertical component \(u_y\)?
wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. Use \(u_y=u\sin30^{\circ}\).

subject: Physics
unit: Unit: Intro to Physics & Scientific Method
question: Net force equals mass times acceleration is:
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: \(F=ma\).

unit: Unit: Intro to Physics & Scientific Method
question: Work can be negative if force opposes displacement.
wrong_response: Review: E.g., friction does negative work.

unit: Unit: Intro to Physics & Scientific Method

wrong_response: Compare with the expected form. Use \(F=ma\).

unit: Unit: Intro to Physics & Scientific Method

question: Opportunity cost best describes:

good_response: Correct! It reflects trade‑offs under scarcity.
wrong_response: Not quite. Hint: It reflects trade‑offs under scarcity.
